marklogic.body:
Careful about that silver nitrate, it's a VERY caustic substance and gave my daughter a serious (we're going to the ER, now!) chemical Burn. I suppose some docs are better about the application process, like applying , telling the parents this is a caustic substance, keep it Off of her skin and properly dressing it - all things our doc didn't do. He was so fired after giving my kid a chemical Burn, thanks to him I had CPS called out to the ER because they thought we had given her a chemical Burn - so frustrating!
But if I had to do it all over again, I'd skip the silver nitrate and go straight to treating it with salt at home, worked like a charm! I would say changing the dressing twice a day isn't nearly enough, change the salt dressings whenever you notice it's wet - salt can only absorb so much moisture at once and the treatment works faster if you keep reapplying dry salt.
